intro: Shehbazia tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan shehbazia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Shehbazia tibetica is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
